title: Java StringWriter class is a character stream that collects output from string buffer, which can be used to construct a string.

inline_content.Text: Java StringWriter class is a character stream that collects output from string buffer, which can be used to construct a string.

title: The StringWriter class extends the Writer class.

inline_content.Text: The StringWriter class extends the Writer class.

title: In StringWriter class, system resources like network sockets and files are not used, therefore closing the StringWriter is not necessary.

inline_content.Text: In StringWriter class, system resources like network sockets and files are not used, therefore closing the StringWriter is not necessary.

title: The above example helps us to know simple example of StringWriter using BufferedReader to read file data from the stream.

inline_content.Text: The above example helps us to know simple example of StringWriter using BufferedReader to read file data from the stream.
